page.title: 10HISTORY OF NORTH HUISH
page.content: There is a wealth of history in the sector, some of it rather obscure, due to lack of recording facilities in the past. Notable families once resided here, leaving much information for dedicated students to research, given time and opportunity. {Archives}at Exeter and Dartington are open to anyone seriously intent on studying or recording it. The school and school- house have both disappeared but records of both probably exist in the Archives, or in the records held by some local families. There were once quarries, possibly slate yielding. Many of the houses are steeped in history, but little researched or publicised. Four {SAXON ESTATES}were listed in the FIRST DOMESDAY BOOK. UGBOROUGH has a ruined{Mediaeval {Mansion}and a contemporary farmhouse once incorporated another.
